name: The Hopkins Phonology Framework
body:
## Welcome to the Hopkins Phonology Framework.
The Hopkins Phonology Framework provides a toolkit for building 
string-valued graphical models for modeling phonology and inferring underlying forms
of words. The framework is built on OpenFST and offers an implementation of several 
inference algorithms as well as pre-built models. We also release datasets
we adapted from exercises in phonology textbooks. 

## Code
### Prerequisites
I've augmented the [pyfst](http://pyfst.github.io/api.html) library by Victor Chahuneau with 
some additional features. I added Cython headers to avoid going through Python, first
order expectation semirings, signed log space, graph search for expected _n_-gram count extraction
and a few other minor things. I plan to wrap the [OpenGRM](http://www.opengrm.org/) library as well as the [push-down transducer](http://www.openfst.org/twiki/bin/view/FST/FstExtensions#FstPdts) extension in the near future.

1. install [OpenFST 1.4.1](http://www.openfst.org/twiki/bin/view/FST/FstDownload) 
2. pip install cython
3. git checkout https://github.com/ryancotterell/hopkins-phonology-framework.git
4. install [mustache](http://mustache.github.io/)
5. cd pyfst
6. make
